headline: winter storm warning in effect
description:
Winter storm continuing into Thursday.

What:
Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 30 cm.
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 4 cm per hour.
Poor visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.
Risk of freezing rain.

When:
Continuing into Thursday evening.

Additional information:
Northerly winds gusting to 50 km/h will result in areas of blowing snow giving reduced visibility. Snow may become mixed with ice pellets and freezing rain later this afternoon into tonight before changing back to snow by early Thursday morning. If this occurs, snowfall amounts may be reduced. The snow is expected to taper to flurries Thursday evening.

Travel is expected to be very difficult at times. Road closures are possible.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve.
